1.speaker: PANDA MAMA
1.definition: If I don't hurry, I'm going to be late! Don't suck me up!

4.speaker: PANDA MAMA
4.definition: Sorry. I have to leave soon, so I'm in a hurry.

5.speaker: PANDA MAMA
5.character: そうだわ！お詫びといっちゃあなんだけど…
5.definition: I know. As an apology... So, she gave you these?

6.speaker: PANDA
6.character: まったくお母さんには困っちゃうよ
6.definition: Seriously, I don't know what I'm going to do with my mom.

7.speaker: PANDA
7.character: 掃除機なんて世界からなくなっちゃえばいいのに
7.definition: Vacuums should just disappear from the world.

8.speaker: PENGUIN
8.character: なくさなくて　いいんじゃないかな？
8.definition: I don't think they need to disappear.

9.speaker: PENGUIN
9.character: キミのとこは　珍しい掃除機の使い方だから
9.definition: The way vacuums are used at your house is rather unique.

10.speaker: PENGUIN
10.definition: Thank you for the food. Hey, this is good. Are those sweets from Toraya, Panda?

11.speaker: PANDA
11.character: さぁ…　お母さんに聞いてよ
11.definition: I don't know. Ask my mom.

12.speaker: PENGUIN
12.character: 魚が好きな僕には　最高のフォルムだし　味もいいよ！
12.definition: It's the perfect form for a fish-lover like me and it tastes great, too.

13.speaker: PENGUIN
13.character: トラヤのお菓子は最高だね！
13.definition: Sweets from Toraya are great. Oh.

14.speaker: POLAR BEAR
14.character: ペンギンさん　うちのお菓子もどう？
14.definition: Mr. Penguin. Would you like to try our sweets, too?

15.speaker: PENGUIN
15.character: あるの？　じゃあ…　いただこうかな！
15.definition: You have some? Sure, I'll have some.

16.speaker: POLAR BEAR
16.character: どうぞ…　シーラカンスだよ
16.definition: Here you go. It's a coelacanth.

18.speaker: PENGUIN
18.character: 生きた化石はお菓子の題材として　どうなんだろうね
18.definition: but I'm not sure about sweetsshaped like a living fossil.

21.speaker: TIGER
21.character: なにぃ～？　今日で辞めさせてくれだと～？
21.definition: What?! You're quitting as of today? Damn, that Zebra...

22.speaker: TIGER
22.character: やっぱり草食系は根性ねえなぁ

25.speaker: TIGER
25.character: こんな昼間にどうした
25.definition: What brings you here so early?

26.speaker: TIGER
26.definition: Are you off today? Yeah, actually...

27.speaker: WOLF
27.character: 先月でパン屋辞めちゃったんだ
27.definition: I quit the bakery last month. Why?!

28.speaker: WOLF
28.character: 勤務時間が長過ぎて　腰痛めちゃって…
28.definition: The work hours were too long and I hurt my back.

29.speaker: TIGER
29.character: おいおい…　大丈夫かよ

30.speaker: WOLF
30.character: なにより…　やっぱりパン屋は　むいてないっぽい
30.definition: It would seem that I'm not fit to work at a bakery.

31.speaker: TIGER
31.character: って！　ま～た自信喪失か？
31.definition: What? You're beating yourself up again?

32.speaker: TIGER
32.character: お前なぁ…　ヘタれてる暇ないって
32.definition: You don't have time to sit around being depressed.

33.speaker: TIGER
33.character: 肉食系なんだから　ガツガツ次行けって！
33.definition: You're a carnivore! Show some guts and go at it!

34.speaker: WOLF
34.character: 僕はトラくんみたいに　強くないんだよ！　ボディもメンタルも！
34.definition: But I'm not as strong as you are, Tiger! Neither physically or mentally!

35.speaker: TIGER
35.character: 猛獣のくせに　僕とか言ってんじゃね～よ！！
35.definition: You're a fierce beast! Don't talk so meekly!

37.character: ただの大きい犬だよ　僕なんて…
37.definition: I'm nothing but an overgrown mutt.

38.speaker: TIGER
38.character: おい…　お前も立派な猛獣だって
38.definition: Hey... You're a fierce beast, too...

39.speaker: WOLF
39.character: 僕…　もうパン屋は諦めて　自転車で日本一周するよ
39.definition: I'm... ...going to forget about the bakery and just ride across Japan on a bicycle.

40.speaker: TIGER
40.character: おい…　日本一周したからって　自分は見つからないぜ
40.definition: Hey... simply riding across Japan doesn't mean you'll find yourself.

41.speaker: WOLF
41.character: じゃあ…　ポエムでも書いて　駅前で売るよ…
41.definition: Then... I'll write poems and sell them in front of the station.

42.speaker: WOLF
42.character: 確かにオオカミだけどよ…
42.definition: Well, yeah, you are a wolf, but... Oh, I know...

43.speaker: TIGER
43.character: なぁ　よかったら　この店手伝ってくれねえか？
43.definition: How about you help me with the shop?

45.speaker: TIGER
45.character: バイトが１人辞めちまって　困ってんだ
45.definition: One of my part-timers just quit, so I'm in a bind.

47.speaker: WOLF
47.definition: S-Sure. So you're having some more today, Mr. Penguin? I'm in the mood for Japanese sweets instead of raw fish today.

48.speaker: POLAR BEAR
48.definition: Mr. Penguin. I have a bad feeling about this... You made something, didn't you?

49.speaker: POLAR BEAR
49.definition: Was it obvious? All right. I'll give it a gander.

50.speaker: POLAR BEAR
50.character: こちらになります　らんちゅう
50.definition: This would be it. It's a ranchu.

53.speaker: PANDA MAMA
53.character: あら　オオカミさんじゃないの
53.definition: Oh, well if it isn't Mr. Wolf.

54.speaker: PANDA MAMA
54.character: あなた　前に　サルさんのパン屋さんにいなかった？
54.definition: Didn't you used to work at Monkey's Bakery?

55.speaker: WOLF
55.character: あそこは辞めたんです　腰痛めちゃって…
55.definition: Actually, don't work there anymore. I hurt my back.

56.speaker: PANDA MAMA
56.definition: Oh my. Are you all right?

58.speaker: WOLF
58.character: 次が決まるまで　ここで　バイトさせてもらってます
58.definition: I'm working here part-time until I find another job.

59.speaker: PANDA MAMA
59.character: まぁ…　早く治るといいわね
59.definition: Oh my. I hope you feel better soon.

60.speaker: WOLF
60.character: はい　ありがとうございます

61.speaker: WOLF
61.character: で　今日は何になさいますか？
61.definition: So, what would you like today? Oh.

62.speaker: PANDA MAMA
62.character: あ　このヤマアラシまん　５個くださる？
62.definition: I'd like five of these porcupine buns.

64.speaker: PANDA MAMA
64.character: 今日は　ヤマアラシファンの　お友達のお家に行くのよ
64.definition: I'm going to visit a friend today, and she's a Yama Arashi fan.

65.speaker: WOLF
65.character: へぇ　そうなんですか

67.speaker: PANDA MAMA
67.definition: Oh, but maybe it's imprudent to eat porcupines... {\a6}We're unstoppable!

68.speaker: PANDA MAMA
68.character: 食べないほうがいいのかしら

69.speaker: YAMA ARASHI
69.character: 食べないほうがいいのかしら

70.character: 食べちゃっていいのかしら…
70.definition: Maybe it's okay to eat them?

71.speaker: WOLF
71.character: 食べちゃって　いいんじゃないすかね
71.definition: I think eating them would be fine.

72.speaker: WOlF
72.character: ありがとうございました

73.speaker: TIGER
73.character: そろそろ　休憩してくれよ
73.definition: Hey, you can take a break.

74.speaker: WOLf
74.definition: Oh, thanks. Tiger, please help yourself to these.

75.speaker: WOLF
75.character: 店のあんこ　もらったから　あんぱん焼いてきたんだ
75.definition: You gave me some of the shop's red bean paste so I made some buns with them.

77.speaker: TIGER
77.character: う　うまい！　パンが香ばしいぜ！
77.definition: They're... delicious! The bread is so fragrant!

78.speaker: WOLF
78.character: 生地に　ふすまを混ぜてるんだよ
78.definition: I added wheat bran into the dough.

80.speaker: WOLF
80.character: 小麦の皮と　胚芽の部分だよ
80.definition: It's the skin and germ of the wheat.

81.speaker: WOLF
81.character: 全粒粉とか使うより　香ばしくなるんだ
81.definition: It becomes more fragrant than using whole wheat flour.

82.speaker: TIGER
82.character: うちのあんと　よく合ってる…
82.definition: It goes really well with our red bean paste.

83.speaker: SASAKO
83.character: ここのところ　毎日それ食べてますね
83.definition: You've been eating those every day lately. Mr. Penguin.

84.speaker: PENGUIN
84.character: もう　何も出さなくていいよ
84.definition: You don't have to bring out anything else.

86.speaker: PANDA MAMA
86.character: ねえねえ　こないだ　遊びに行ったお友達ね
86.definition: So that friend I mentioned visiting the other day...

87.speaker: PANDA MAMA
87.character: ご主人がパン屋さんだったのよ

88.speaker: PANDA MAMA
88.character: ロバのパン屋さんって　ご存じ
88.definition: Do you know of Donkey's Bakery?

90.speaker: WOLF
90.character: あそこのパンは　すごくおいしくて　尊敬してます
90.definition: Their bread is incredibly delicious.I really admire them.

91.speaker: PANDA MAMA
91.definition: They were looking for a new hire. Wha?! No, no. I couldn't.

92.speaker: WOLF
92.character: まだまだ修業しないと！
92.definition: I still have much to learn.

93.speaker: TIGER
93.definition: Sounds like a great opportunity to me.

95.speaker: TIGER
95.character: こいつは　こう見えて

96.speaker: TIGER
96.character: なかなか　センスがあるんですよ
96.definition: he really knows what he's doing.

98.speaker: TIGER
98.character: あんぱん食べたら　わかったよ
98.definition: I knew as soon as I ate your buns.

99.speaker: PANDA MAMA
99.character: トラさんが認めるなら　たしかよね
99.definition: If Mr. Tiger says so, there's no doubt about it.

100.speaker: WOLF
100.character: いや　待ってください

101.speaker: WOLF
101.character: 僕なんて　ロバさんのところで　働くには　まだまだ…
101.definition: I'm definitely not skilled enough to work at Mr. Donkey's...

102.speaker: PANDA MAMA
102.definition: I don't think they were in any hurry.

103.speaker: PANDA MAMA
103.character: とりあえず　伝えておくわね
103.definition: I just wanted to tell you just in case.

104.speaker: BOTH
104.character: あ…　ありがとうございました

107.speaker: TIGER
107.character: パン屋修業が終わったら　自分の店　出すんだよな？
107.definition: Once you're done training at a bakery, you were going to open your own place, right?

108.speaker: WOLF
108.character: そうできたらいいなって　思ってるだけだよ
108.definition: I was just thinking...it'd be nice if I could do that.

109.speaker: TIGER
109.character: そんときは　あんぱんに　うちのあんこ　わけてやるよ
109.definition: When that happens, You can use our red beanpaste in your buns.

111.speaker: WOLF
111.character: だって…　トラヤのあんこって

112.speaker: WOLF
112.character: あのロバのパン屋さんがあれほど欲しがったのに　あげなかったんでしょ？
112.definition: Mr. Donkey wanted desperately to use it at his bakery, but you refused, didn't you?

113.speaker: TIGER
113.character: バカ野郎　お前だから　わけてやんだよ
113.definition: You idiot. I'd give you some because it's you.

114.speaker: TIGER
114.character: ライオンも　お前が店出すときは
114.definition: Even Lion said that when you open your own shop,

115.speaker: TIGER
115.character: 出資するって　楽しみにしてんだぜ
115.definition: he'd invest in it and was looking forward to it.

117.speaker: TIGER
117.character: グリズリーさんだって　そうだ

118.speaker: GRIZZLY
118.character: あいつのパンなら　喜んで店のパンに使ってやるぜ
118.definition: I'd be more than happy to have his baked goods at my bar.

119.speaker: TIGER
119.character: みんな　お前が一人前になるのを　待ってるんだぜ
119.definition: Everyone is waiting for you to come into your own.

121.speaker: WOLF
121.character: みんな　猛獣のくせに　なんて　あったかいんだ！
121.definition: All of you are supposed to be fierce beasts, but you're so kind.

122.speaker: WOLF
122.character: 俺　みんなのために頑張るよ！
122.definition: I'll do my best for everyone's sake!

127.speaker: WOLF
127.character: パンダママさんの紹介で来ました　オオカミです
127.definition: My name is Wolf and I came here on Panda Mama's referral.

130.speaker: WOLF
130.character: はい　こちらになります
130.definition: Yes. I have it right here.

131.speaker: WOLF
131.character: よろしくお願いします
131.definition: Thank you for your consideration. What's the matter, Tiger? You seem preoccupied. I keep thinking that you'll hear back about your interview today,

132.speaker: TIGER
132.character: 気が気じゃねえんだよ

134.speaker: WOLF
134.character: 受かっても落ちても　僕
134.definition: Pass or fail, I've decided to

135.character: もう　パン一筋でいくよ
135.definition: become a baker, no matter what.

138.speaker: WOLF
138.character: はい…　オオカミです

139.speaker: WOLF
139.character: はい…　あ…　そうですか

140.speaker: WOLF
140.character: はい　わかりました

143.speaker: WOLF
143.character: 受かった！受かったよ　トラくん！
143.definition: I got it! I got it, Tiger!

144.speaker: TIGER
144.character: やったじゃねえか　この野郎！

145.speaker: TIGER
145.character: よし！　今夜は　グリズリーバー　行くぞ！
145.definition: All right! We're going to the Grizzly Bar tonight! Great job, Wolf, you rascal! I see.

146.speaker: GRIZZLY
146.character: 今夜は　ぶっ倒れるまで飲んでけ！
146.definition: Drink until you pass out tonight.

148.speaker: TIGER
148.character: やったぜ！　じゃあ　俺　マティーニ！
148.definition: All right! I'll take a martini.

151.speaker: GRIZZLY
151.character: 誰が　てめえに　おごるって言ったよ！！
151.definition: Who the hell said it'd be on the house for you?! Mr. Penguin hasn't been by much lately.

152.speaker: POLAR BEAR
152.definition: Now that you mention it... I thought it was rather quiet. I guess it's because Mr. Penguin's not here.

153.speaker: SASAKO
153.character: 何か忙しいんですかね？
153.definition: I wonder if he's been busy.

154.speaker: POlAR BEAR
154.definition: Who knows? Maybe he took a vacation?

160.speaker: LLAMA
160.character: あれ？　ペンギンさん？

162.speaker: LLAMA
162.character: どうしたんですか？こんな所で

165.character: 隣町にある　ヒグマさんが　マスターのカフェです
165.definition: It's a café in the next town run by Mr. Brown Bear.

166.speaker: POLAR BEAR
166.character: ヒグマが　ヒグマカフェ？
166.definition: Brown Bear runs Brown Bear's Café? Not very original, is it?

167.speaker: LLAMA
167.character: しろくまカフェも　そのまんまですよね
167.definition: The same could be said about Polar Bear's Café.

168.speaker: LLAMA
168.character: ペンギンさん　毎日　行ってるって　言ってましたよ
168.definition: Mr. Penguin was saying he's been going every day.

169.speaker: PANDA
169.character: 毎日？　ペンギンさん　シロクマカフェに　飽きちゃったのかな？
169.definition: Every day? I wonder if Mr. Penguin got tired of Polar Bear's Café.

170.speaker: LLAMA
170.character: ず～っと　いましたからね

171.speaker: SASAKO
171.character: ず～っと　いましたよね

172.speaker: PENGUIN
172.character: 聞いてよ　笹子さん

173.speaker: PENGUIN
173.character: 僕　お店で食べきれなくて　残しちゃったときに
173.definition: I figured out a non-embarrassing way to take home leftovers

174.speaker: PENGUIN
174.character: 恥ずかしくなく持って帰る方法　考えついたんだけどさ

175.speaker: PANDA
175.character: ずっと　しゃべってたよね
175.definition: He was always talking, wasn't he?

176.speaker: SASAKO
176.character: ず～っと　しゃべってましたね

177.speaker: PENGUIN
177.character: カフェモカ　おかわり
177.definition: Could I get another café mocha?

178.speaker: PENGUIN
178.character: 僕は　しろくまカフェの　カフェモカがあれば
178.definition: As long as I have a café mocha from Polar Bear's Café, I don't need anything else.

179.speaker: PENGUIN
179.definition: But I do need fish, though.

180.speaker: SASAKO
180.character: いるんじゃないですか…

181.speaker: SASAKO
181.character: ず～っと　カフェモカ飲んでましたね
181.definition: He was always drinking café mocha, wasn't he?

182.speaker: LLAMA
182.character: カフェモカに　飽きちゃったんですかね？
182.definition: Maybe he got tired of café mochas?

183.speaker: PANDA
183.character: もしかして　ヒグマカフェのカフェモカしろくまカフェより　おいしいのかな？
183.definition: Maybe Brown Bear's Café's café mocha tastes better than Polar Bear's Café's? Mr. Penguin is allowed to be at any café he wants to be at.

184.speaker: SASAKO
184.character: それはそうですけど　寂しいじゃないですか
184.definition: That's true, but... It's a little lonely, don't you think?

187.speaker: SASAKO
187.character: シロクマさん　寂しくないんですか
187.definition: Aren't you the least bit lonely, Mr. Polar Bear?

190.speaker: POLAR BEAR
190.character: すいません　カフェモカください
190.definition: Pardon me. Could I get a café mocha, please?

192.speaker: POLAR BEAR
192.character: あれ？　チョコレートシロップが　少し多すぎるな
192.definition: Oh? There's a bit too much chocolate syrup.

195.speaker: BROWN BEAR
195.definition: Please have a seat wherever you'd like.

202.speaker: PENGUIN
202.character: お店行かなくてごめんね
202.definition: sorry I haven't been by the café lately.

203.speaker: POLAR BEAR
203.character: どこのカフェに行ったって　ペンギンさんの自由だよ
203.definition: You're allowed to go to any café you want, Mr. Penguin.

204.speaker: PENGUIN
204.character: もしかして　怒ってる？

206.speaker: PENGUIN
206.character: そう　ならいいけど

207.speaker: POLAR BEAR
207.character: このお店のカフェモカが好きなの？
207.definition: Do you like this café's café mocha?

208.speaker: PENGUIN
208.character: ここのは甘みが強すぎて　あんまり好きじゃないんだ
208.definition: They make it too sweet here,and I don't really like it.

212.speaker: WAITRESS
212.character: ご注文は　お決まりですか？
212.definition: Are you ready to order? W-Well... Um!

215.speaker: PENGUIN
215.character: カ　カフェモカくれる？
215.definition: C-Could I get a café mocha?

216.speaker: WAITRESS
216.character: はい　カフェモカですね

217.speaker: WAITRESS
217.character: 少々　お待ちください

218.speaker: POLAR BEAR
218.definition: So that's it. Yeah. That's how it is.

219.speaker: PENGUIN
219.character: だから　シロクマくん

220.speaker: PENGUIN
220.character: お店行けなくてごめん
220.definition: I'm sorry I haven't been to the Café.

223.speaker: POLAR BEAR
223.character: お店にこなくても　友達でしょ？
223.definition: We're friends, even if you don't come by the Café, right?

225.speaker: POLAR BEAR
225.character: 応援するよ　ペンギンさん
225.definition: I'll be rooting for you, Mr. Penguin.

226.speaker: PENGUIN
226.character: ありがとう　シロクマくん

227.speaker: PENGUIN
227.character: 僕　あの子に告白するまで　ヒグマカフェに通うよ
227.definition: I'll keep stopping by Brown Bear's Café until I can ask her out!

228.speaker: POLAR BEAR
228.definition: Okay, got it. I'm gonna do my best.

229.speaker: PENGUIN
229.character: 早く　シロクマくんのカフェモカ　飲みたいからさ
229.definition: I want to hurry and drink one of your café mochas.

230.speaker: PENGUIN
230.character: パンダくんたちにも　よろしく言っといて
230.definition: Tell Panda and the others I said "hi," as well.

232.speaker: PANDA
232.character: 仕事で　ゴロゴロするのも大変だよ
232.definition: It's so hard to laze around at work.

233.speaker: PANDA
233.character: 今からは　プライベートでゴロゴロしよっと
233.definition: I'm going to go laze around at home now.

234.speaker: SASAKO
234.character: ゴロゴロにも　いろいろ　あるんだね
234.definition: So there's more than one kind of lazing around...

235.speaker: PANDA
235.character: あれ？　今日も　ペンギンさん来なかったの？
235.definition: Oh, Mr. Penguin didn't come today, either?

237.speaker: SASAKO
237.character: 本当に　どうしちゃったんだろう…

240.speaker: WAITRESS
240.definition: Hello. Oh, would you like your usual? Y-Yes, please!

241.speaker: SASAKO
241.character: えっ？　また　ペンギンさん　好きな人が　できたんですか？
241.definition: What? Mr. Penguin has a new crush?

242.speaker: POLAR BEAR
242.character: 告白するまで　うちには来られないから
242.definition: He said he wouldn't be able to come here until he asks her out,

243.speaker: POLAR BEAR
243.character: みんなに　よろしくって
243.definition: so he asked me to say hi for him.

244.speaker: SASAKO
244.definition: It took him quite a while to ask out Miss Penko, didn't it?

245.speaker: PANDA
245.character: ２年くらい　来られないかもしれないね
245.definition: He might not be able to come by for a couple years.

248.speaker: PENGUIN
248.character: へぇ～　ベアーズ　勝ったんだ
248.definition: Wow, the Bears won. I see. Mr. Penguin. You're not going to Brown Bear's Café today?

249.speaker: PENGUIN
249.character: やっぱり　僕のカフェはしろくまカフェしかないよ
249.definition: My only café is Polar Bear's Café after all.

250.speaker: PANDA
250.character: ということは　ペンギンさんフラれた…

251.speaker: SASAKO
251.character: パンダくん　こういう時は　そっとしておいてあげて
251.definition: Panda. Please leave him be at times like these.

252.speaker: PENGUIN
252.character: いいんだよ　笹子さん

253.speaker: PENGUIN
253.character: いつ飲んでも　ここのカフェモカはおいしいから
253.definition: The café mochas here are always so good that I can't stop myself.

254.speaker: PENGUIN
254.character: ねぇ　笹子さん　パンダくん

256.speaker: PENGUIN
256.character: 今すぐ２人で　僕を励ましてよ！
256.definition: Could you two cheer me up right now?

257.speaker: PENGUIN
257.character: 僕の　いいところを　パ～ッて言ってあげて！
257.definition: Tell me {\i1}all{\i0} the great things about me!

259.speaker: PENGUIN
259.character: そう　ジャストナウ！　今！

260.speaker: PENGUIN
260.character: ほら　早くして　もう　頼むよ～！
260.definition: Come on now, let's hurry it up. Come on!

262.speaker: PANDA
262.character: やっぱり　ペンギンさんの　めんどくささがないと
262.definition: Polar Bear's Café just isn't the same

263.speaker: PANDA
263.character: しろくまカフェじゃないね
263.definition: without Mr. Penguin being a nuisance.

264.speaker: PANDA
264.character: ねっ　シロクマくん

266.speaker: PENGUIN
266.character: 褒められてる気分と　責められてる気分のハーフ＆ハーフだな～
266.definition: I feel like I'm being praised and attacked at the same time.

267.speaker: POLAR BEAR
267.character: カフェモカ　おかわり？
267.definition: Would you like another café mocha? Yeah, I think I would.

268.speaker: PENGUIN
268.character: じゃ　僕の　いいところについて　ジャンジャン言ってよ！
268.definition: All right. Bring on the praises!

269.speaker: PANDA
269.character: もう　売り切れたよ

271.speaker: SASAKO
271.character: えっ…　そうですね…　品切れです
271.definition: Huh? Well, let's see... I'm out of stock.

273.speaker: POLAR BEAR
273.character: ペンギンさんの　いいところは人気があるから
273.definition: I think all of the good things about you were so popular,

274.speaker: POLAR BEAR
274.character: 買い占められちゃったかな
274.definition: that they all got bought up.

275.speaker: PENGUIN
275.character: シロクマくん！　上手いこと言ってないで
275.definition: Quit being witty and say something

276.character: 僕の　いいところ言ってよ～！

277.speaker: PANDA
277.character: ペンギンさん　ペンギンさん

279.speaker: PANDA
279.character: ノーベル賞がとれるような大発見あったら教えてよ
279.definition: If you know of some discovery worthy of the Nobel Prize, you should let me know.

280.speaker: PENGUIN
280.definition: I don't think I know of any.

281.speaker: PENGUIN
281.character: もしあったら　君に教えずにノーベル賞をいただいてるよ
281.definition: Even if I did, I wouldn't tell you and I'd get the Nobel Prize myself.

282.speaker: PANDA
282.character: じゃ　ただの大発見でいいよ
282.definition: Then how about a normal discovery?

284.character: 出入り時バタバタするっているとだいたい怒られないよね
284.definition: saying you were in a hurry usually gets you out of trouble.

287.speaker: POLAR BEAR
287.character: 来週のしろくまカフェは

288.speaker: POLAR BEAR
288.definition: will only have one moving part.

289.speaker: PENGUIN
289.definition: Let's make sure it's moving in general.
